sentences.english: The judge found him guilty of unpardonable evil.
sentences.chinese: 法官認定他的罪行十惡不赦。

sentences.english: We are much too apt to look at schism in our church as an unmitigated evil.
sentences.chinese: 我們太容易把自己教會中的分立看成是十惡不赦的。

sentences.english: Fabricating data is a heinous scientific sin.
sentences.chinese: 捏造數據是十惡不赦的科學之罪。

sentences.english: There is no act more wretched than stealing, Amir, ?Baba said.
sentences.chinese: 沒有比盜竊更十惡不赦的事情了，阿米爾。

sentences.english: There is no act more wretched than stealing.
sentences.chinese: 沒有比盜竊更十惡不赦的事情了。

sentences.english: “Nothing is totally good or totally bad, ” Wu says.
sentences.chinese: “沒有任何事物是十全十美或者十惡不赦的，”吳說。

sentences.english: There is no more heinous than stealing things, and Amir.
sentences.chinese: 沒有比盜竊更十惡不赦的事情了，阿米爾。

sentences.english: I wonder how this wicked kind of people could enter the revolutionary rank?
sentences.chinese: 我懷疑有多少這種十惡不赦樣的人可以進入革命隊伍？

sentences.english: Time, heinous things, of course, I am all the looting.
sentences.chinese: 時間，十惡不赦的東西，理所當然地掠奪我的一切。

definition: to write off at one stroke
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
lit. knifes piercing both sides (idiom)/fig. to attach a great importance to friendship, up to the point of being able to sacrifice oneself for it
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
